name: interpretive-orchestration
description: Atelier of Co-Apprenticeship for interpretive qualitative research. Human and AI learn together as apprentices to the craft tradition (rigor, reflexivity, theoretical sensitivity). Three stages: Solo Practice → Side-by-Side Collaboration → Dialogue with Tradition. Instantiates Partnership Agency from Cognitio Emergens framework. Prevents calculator mindset, embeds meta-cognition, maintains human interpretive authority. Built with care on Gioia/Constructivist principles.

author.name: Xule Lin and Kevin Corley (Imperial College London)

features: Sequential Thinking for deep analytical reasoning

core_principles: Co-apprenticeship: Both human and AI apprentice to craft tradition
Partnership Agency: Emergent cognition neither could achieve alone (Cognitio Emergens)
Atelier methodology: Solo Practice → Side-by-Side Collaboration → Dialogue with Tradition
Craft epistemology: Build with care, reflexivity, and theoretical sensitivity
Meta-cognition embedded: Both human and AI learn and adapt
Interpretive Intelligence: Visible reasoning prevents epistemic alienation

components: Sequential Thinking and Lotus Wisdom MCPs for epistemic scaffolding
mvep.success_metric: Transforms how you think about interpretation (not just coding speed)
mvep.argument: Partnership Agency requires: theoretical foundation + visible reasoning + reflexive practice + philosophical coherence

pedagogical_approach.initial_use: Socratic onboarding, simple workflows, foundational prompts
pedagogical_approach.developing_practice: Deeper epistemic questions emerge through use
pedagogical_approach.progression: Philosophy deepens through practice, not predetermined timeline
